definition: lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth/also written 如癡如醉|如痴如醉[ru2 chi1 ru2 zui4]

sentences.chinese: 好一個癡癲的穴居男人。

sentences.english: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
sentences.chinese: 老友的好處之一就是你可與之耍瘋扮癡。

sentences.english: Now, I find I have a little silly. Maybe always I am.
sentences.chinese: 發現自己現在有點癡，也許我一直都是個癡人。

sentences.english: The happy pleasure, leaves the pain, had the crazy children.
sentences.chinese: 歡樂趣，離別苦，就中更有癡兒女。

sentences.english: As such, only computer junkies can understand its significance.
sentences.chinese: 因此它的意義只能爲電腦迷癡們所領會。

sentences.english: The marquis's eye became round because he had a mania for horse.
sentences.chinese: 武侯眼睛睜得更大了，因爲他是有名的馬癡。

sentences.english: You can't expect him to be able to do it, he's not all there.
sentences.chinese: 你不能指望他能夠勝任，他癡頭呆腦的。

sentences.english: Listen strings broke, break it three thousand corners, the spouses.
We gaze at each other as dumb animals gaze at human beings.
sentences.chinese: 我們啞口無言，像愚笨的動物癡望人類一樣面面相覷。

sentences.english: That is the story of the Snowdrop.
Really able to recite, no longer from the Tan Tianchi, that great precepts.
sentences.chinese: 真能唸佛，不復起貪瞋癡，即大持戒。

sentences.english: Fakir is a fictitious world constructed with "fairy-tale".
sentences.chinese: 《癡愚說客》是用“童話”演繹的虛擬世界。

sentences.english: Perfect mental balance on the relative level involves equalizing desire, anger, ignorance, jealousy and pride.
sentences.chinese: 完美的心靈和諧需要平息內心的貪嗔癡慢疑。

sentences.english: Fortune often knocks at the door, but the fool does not invite her in.
sentences.chinese: 幸運之神常光顧，癡人不知把門開。
